result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas Theodore Hartwig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Seek/maintain full time employment/educaiton or combination per agent

Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment and/or evaluation per agent.  Not to possess controlled substances w/o valid prescription and must notify agent w/in 48 hours if one is received.  Absolute Sobriety of alcohol and controlled substances.

Defendant Nicholas Theodore Hartwig in court with attorney Joseph L Viney and Maura Melka.  Defendant Nicholas Theodore Hartwig in custody.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and State states appearances.  Matters are all resolved along w/2 Columbia Co cases.  14CF134 includes information Col Co cases.  State states recs.  DE attorney's waive prelims in 15CF134, 14CF289 and 14CF52.  Court questions DE on prelim waivers/accepts/finds probable cause and binds over.  Court reviews application for consolidation and approves that.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts.  Court addresses arraignment on 14CF432.  Attorney Melka acknowledges rec. information, waives reading and stands by her previous NC pleas.  Atty Viney does the same.  Court advises DE of all charges/max penalties.  NC pleas accepted and Court dismisses/reads-in all agreed charges.  Parties review VIS.  State makes statement.  Atty's Viney and Melka make statements.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  Jail credit is yet to be determined in writing.  

Columbia Co cases 14CF162 and 14CF218 consolidated...14CF162 is on information for Sauk Co case 15CF134
